abstract: Electrolux, the European appliance maker, reported second-quarter profit that missed analysts’ estimates and reduced its full-year earnings forecast after sales declined in the United States and Europe.
snippet: Electrolux, the European appliance maker, reported second-quarter profit that missed analysts’ estimates and reduced its full-year earnings forecast after sales declined in the United States and Europe.
lead_paragraph: Electrolux, the European appliance maker, reported second-quarter profit that missed analysts’ estimates and reduced its full-year earnings forecast after sales declined in the United States and Europe. Electrolux, based in Stockholm, said net income fell to 99 million kronor ($16.5 million) from 545 million kronor a year earlier on costs to close factories and upgrade products. The chief executive, Hans Straaberg, above, predicted European and North American markets would shrink this year. Electrolux cut its earnings outlook twice this year.
